name: Mawby Creek Canyon
description:
A beautiful canyon through the trees descending down into the Squamish River. The approach to this canyon has now been completed and there is flagging showing the path to take up to the top of the big drop. This is at approximately 500m elevation. KML file for the path to take will be added.

Here is a link to a photo album of the most recent scouting trip. Scouting Sept 2020

The canyon has now been partially descended by Artem Bylinskii, Nick Hindley, and Michael Henson (August 13th 2022). Mostly natural anchors were used. Water level was high and problematic at some locations. First Partial Descent

Approach

Put in under the bridge which crosses the Squamish river at the Ashlu River campground. Float down the river until you pass Madden Falls and then as you go around the corner you will see where Mawby Creek joins the Squamish. This year there was a nice little beach there and a decent eddy. Lots of animals in this area. We saw fresh wolf and grizzly foot prints on the sand. Plan for a grizzly to gnaw on your water craft and be prepared for that outcome. Make your way into the forest about 30m to the north of Mawby Creek. From here hike up the hill parallel to Mawby Creek following animal trails. As the hill gets steeper you will see flagging which takes you up the best route to the 500m elevation required to start this canyon.

Trip Reports

August 14th 2022 Artem Bylinskii, Nick Hindley, Michael Henson descended the top ~250m of vertical using mostly natural anchors. Longest drop was around 90m and we created a belay station about 20m into it. Water level was uncomfortably high, and we did our best to avoid being in the flow.
